title: Interface to RELAX-IV
text: Package website: release | development RELAX-IV minimum cost flow solver implementation FORTRAN Dimitri P. Bertsekas Paul Tseng made accessible inside R.

title: Interface to RELAX-IV
text: two functions interfacing RELAX-IV solver. first, RELAX_IV(), intended users includes simplified interface input sanitization. ’s inputs characteristics graph, returns flow across edges. advanced usage, consider .RELAX_IV() function. features input sanitization complex interface. ’s inputs advanced characteristics graph, returns complete set results.

title: Interface to RELAX-IV

title: Interface to RELAX-IV
text: drat package can used install package. Windows/Mac systems install binary version, meaning FORTRAN required set system. *nix based systems, install source therefore requires gfortran installed. following command add repo list sources, interacts install.packages update.packages. Unfortunately drat::addRepo needs run time plan installing updating. may better served adding drat::addRepo line .Rprofile. See wiki page details support drat various systems.

title: Interface to RELAX-IV
text: Installing using devtools build package source directly repo. can either build recent release current development version last commit repo Building source requires gfortran.

title: Interface to RELAX-IV
text: Binaries can also installed manually without use external packages. can download binary releases directory repository, build source (note building source requires gfortran). downloading, install

title: Lower-level access to the RELAX-IV algorithm — .RELAX_IV
text: n1 Number nodes na1 Number arcs startn1 Starting nodes endn1 Ending nodes c1 Costs vector u1 Capacities b1 Demands rc1 Reduced Costs crash1 Set crash1 equal 1 activate auction/shortest path subroutine getting initial price-flow pair. recommended difficult problems default initialization yields long solution times. Default 0. large1 large integer represent infinity

title: Lower-level access to the RELAX-IV algorithm — .RELAX_IV
